lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing package¶

Submodules¶

lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstr_iterations_temp_function module¶

class lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstr_iterations_temp_function.AbstrIterationsTempFunction¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Template class for determining the number of iterations for a temperature.

Implementations of this class are meant to be used in a simulated annealing algorithm. Implementations are supposed to be used to determine the amount of iterations for a certain temperature.

abstract get_iterations(temperature)¶

Returns the amount of iterations for a certain temperature.

Parameters

Temperature (int or float) – The current temperature.

lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstract_cooling_function module¶

class lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstract_cooling_function.AbstractCoolingFunction¶

Bases: abc.ABC

A template class to implement a cooling function for simulated annealing.

Implementations of this class are meant to be used in a simulated annealing algorithm. Implementations are supposed to implement the cooling function.

abstract next_temperature(old_temperature)¶

Function to get the next temperature

Parameters

old_temperature (int or float) – The old temperature

Returns

The new temperature

Return type

int or float

lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.cnst_iterations_temp_function module¶

class lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.cnst_iterations_temp_function.CnstIterationsTempFunction(iterations=1000)¶

Bases: lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstr_iterations_temp_function.AbstrIterationsTempFunction

Class for determining the number of iterations for a temperature.

This class is meant to be used in a simulated annealing algorithm. The amount of iterations is constant and is not influenced by the temperature.

Parameters

iterations (int) – The amount of iterations for all temperatures.

_iterations¶

The amount of iterations for all temperatures. Default is 1000.

Type

int

Examples

Default behaviour:

With 800 iterations:

get_iterations(temperature)¶

Returns the amount of iterations for a certain temperature.

Parameters

temperature (int or float) – The “temperature” in the simulated annealing algorithm.

Returns

The amount of iterations for the temperature. (Here always _iterations)

Return type

int

lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.geometric_cooling_function module¶

class lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.geometric_cooling_function.GeometricCoolingFunction(alpha=0.75)¶

Bases: lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.abstract_cooling_function.AbstractCoolingFunction

Implements a geometric cooling function for simulated annealing.

Parameters

alpha (float, optional) – A parameter that influences the cooling rate. Should be a positive number smaller than 1. Default is 0.75.

_alpha¶

A parameter that influences the cooling rate.

Type

float

Examples

A simple example:

An example with an alpha of 0.5:

next_temperature(old_temperature)¶

Function to get the next temperature.

Parameters

old_temperature (int or float) – The old temperature.

Returns

The new temperature. This temperature is equal to:

\[\_alpha*old\_temperature\]

Return type

float

lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.simulated_annealing module¶

class lclpy.localsearch.simulatedannealing.simulated_annealing.SimulatedAnnealing(problem, termination_criterion, cooling_function, iterations_for_temp_f, start_temperature=2000, minimise=True, benchmarking=False, logging=True)¶

Bases: lclpy.localsearch.abstract_local_search.AbstractLocalSearch

Performs a simulated annealing algorithm with the given parameters.

Parameters

  • problem (AbstractLocalSearchProblem) – Contains all the data needed for the specific problem.

  • termination_criterion (AbstractTerminationCriterion) – Implements a termination criterion to terminate the algorithm.

  • cooling_function (AbstractCoolingFunction) – Implements the cooling function for the algorithm.

  • iterations_for_temp_f (AbstrIterationsTempFunction) – Implements a function to determine the amount of iterations for a certain temperature.

  • start_temperature (int, optional) – The starting temperature for the simulated annealing. The default is 2000.

  • minimise (bool, optional) – Will minimise if this parameter is True, maximise if it is False. The default is True.

  • benchmarking (bool, optional) – Should be True if one wishes benchmarks to be kept, should be False if one wishes no benchmarks to be made. Default is False.

  • logging (bool, optional) – Improvements and passed worse solutions will be logged to the command line if this variable is True. Default is True.

_problem¶

Contains all the data needed for the specific problem.

Type

AbstractLocalSearchProblem

_termination_criterion¶

Implements a termination criterion to terminate the algorithm.

Type

AbstractTerminationCriterion

_cooling_function¶

Implements the cooling function for the algorithm.

Type

AbstractCoolingFunction

_iterations_for_temp_f¶

Implements a function to determine the amount of iterations for a certain temperature.

Type

AbstrIterationsTempFunction

_start_temperature¶

The start “temperature”.

Type

int

_temperature¶

The current “temperature”.

Type

int

_acceptance_function¶

The acceptance function used.

Type

SimulatedAnnealingAcceptanceFunction

_is_improvement¶

Function used to determine if a certain delta value is an improvement or equal to the current value.

_is_better¶

Function used to determine if a certain value is an improvement.

data¶

Data useable for benchmarking. Will be None if no benchmarks are made.

Type

list of tuple

_data_append¶

Function to append new data-points to data. Will do nothing if no benchmarks are made.

_log_improvement¶

Function to write logs to the command line. Will do nothing if no logs are made.

_log_passed_worse¶

Function to write logs to the command line. Will do nothing if no logs are made.

Examples

Minimising example:

Maximising example, note that the distance matrix is different:

reset()¶

Resets the object back to it’s state after init.

Raises

NotImplementedError – If the problem or termination criterion have no reset method implemented.

Examples

Minimising example, reset after run:

run()¶

Starts running the simulated annealing algorithm.

Returns

  • best_order (numpy.ndarray) – The best found order.

  • best_value (int or float) – The evaluation value of the best found order.

  • data (None or collections.namedtuple) – Data useable for benchmarking. If no benchmarks were made, it will be None. The namedtuple contains the following data in numpy.ndarrays: time, iteration, temperature, value, best_value

Module contents¶

This package contains all classes unique to simulated annealing.

lclpy
